page.title: 04The Old Village
page.content: The old village of Seaton Sluice was based around the main attraction, the Harbour which from the thirteenth century until the late nineteenth century was the hub of industry and social life of the community. For a period, The lord of the manor resided here. Sir John Delaval lived for many years at Seaton lodge, a fine old house standing in the dene on the North bank of the burn. The lodge was built in 1670 by Thomas Harwood. Sir Ralph Delaval purchased it in 1684. At one time a footbridge spanned the river to enable Sir John to visit the glass works.
